titleStmt.title: A Fragment of Demosthenes' de Corona

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - This is good to go.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - I vetted the text against Sardone's edition, and noted only minor differences in dots. Variant readings should be tagged only if they are not otherwise attested (i.e., ii.7, but not ii.3). Remove ii.16 and other cases of restored words at column beginning or end. I'd call the *ruler* of iii.5 a *filler(extension)*. Fix the |ed| tags in iii.8 and iii.9. Check Dilts' reading for the infinitive in iii.10. Review all metadata before finalization

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - I vetted the text against Sardone's edition, and noted only minor differences in dots. Variant readings should be tagged only if they are not otherwise attested (i.e., ii.7, but not ii.3). Remove ii.16 and other cases of restored words at column beginning or end. I'd call the *ruler* of iii.5 a *filler(extension)*. Fix the |ed| tags in iii.8 and iii.9. Check Dilts' reading for the infinitive in iii.10. Review all metadata before finalization

Submit - Entered text and modified metadata according to Sardone's reedition (I based myself on the openly available 2018 version of his PhD). I usde |ed| tags to mark differences from Dills edition of the De Corona, and used Dills to fill the lacunas and to provide accentuation and punctuation to the text. Some problems while encoding: col. ii, l. 12, I added a commentary to explain the complex editorial marking; col. iii, l. 1, Dills used parentheses as modern punctuation, I removed them in order not to break Leiden+; col. iii, l. 5, I did not know how to encode the ruler at the end of the line, so I made something up that is surely to be corrected while finalizing. Encoded during a one-day workshop at University of Basel. Thank you for Revising!
